_comment: Template for defining a batch processing job
A descriptive name for the job
description: This is an example batch job that processes a list of user IDs.
_comment: A more detailed description of the job's purpose
The API endpoint to be called for each item in the batch.  Use {item_id} placeholders for substitutions.
The HTTP method to use for the API calls (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH)

headers._comment: Optional headers to include in the API requests

_comment: Optional template for the request body. Leave null for GET requests. Can use {item_id} placeholders.
_comment_items: An array of item IDs to process in the batch
_comment: If items is a list of objects, this is the key to use for the item ID.  If null, items is treated as a list of IDs.
The maximum number of concurrent API requests to make
The number of times to retry a failed API request
The delay in seconds between retry attempts
HTTP status codes that indicate a successful API call
How to handle errors: 'continue' to process all items, 'stop' to halt on first error
Optional URL to call when the job is complete, passing job status and results.  e.g. https://your-app.com/batch-callback
The HTTP method for the callback URL (POST, PUT)

callback_headers._comment: Optional headers for the callback request

metadata._comment: Optional metadata to associate with the job.  Useful for tracking or filtering jobs.
